resources.string: A material design status bar replacement. No root needed.
An item with this name already exists.
You are missing one or more required icons.
\'Status Service\' needs to be enabled in order to detect window changes to update the status bar. On some phones you may need to scroll to the bottom of the screen before it becomes visible.

On some versions of android the app cannot use the standard notification listener API to display the notification icons. I have found a way to detect them through the accessibility service, however it cannot detect when a notification has been dismissed. Thus, it removes all notifications whenever the notification panel is opened. If you do not like this, you can either check for a firmware update or disable the notifications in the settings menu. Please note: this setting will break the notification icons on some devices. It is recommended not to enable this feature on versions of android that are newer than Lollipop.
The app needs to read incoming notifications in order to display notification icons on the status bar.
This app needs a few additional permissions in order to access parts of the phone relevant to the status bar. An explanation of why these are needed is provided in the Status\'s Play Store page.
Battery Optimizations will cause Status to stop working as the system will close Status to save battery life. This must be disabled in order for Status to function correctly.
The app needs to be able to draw an overlay on top of the screen so that it can show the status bar.
The clock will show in a 24 hour time format if this is turned on.
Choose whether to show the AM/PM indicator in the clock.
Shows the date next to the time in the clock.
Notifications will \'peek\' from the top of the screen whenever an important notification is received.
Set the amount of time for the app to show a heads-up notification for.
Shows the battery percentage next to the icon in the status bar.
Picks the status bar color from the current application. This may cause a significant decrease in performance depending on the device.
Set the color for the status bar to use on a specific screen. This will override any other color options provided the \'automatic status bar coloring\' option is enabled.

This option sets the status bar\'s background as the current wallpaper when the home screen is displayed. This setting will not work correctly on live wallpapers or if your home screen\'s scrolling wallpaper option is enabled.
Adjusts the color of the icons to avoid invisible or hard to see icons on light backgrounds.
Changes the color of the icons instead of the status bar background, which will be set to the default color.
If your phone has more than one sim card, this option will show two signal indicators instead of one.
Shows whether the data connection is 2G, 3G, 4G, or unknown/none (doesn\'t show anything).
The app will show a notification as a shortcut to set the color for an app if the a color has not been found.
This option allows you to enable or disable animating of the status bar background color. This may impact performance on slower devices.
This option lets you toggle the icon animations, which can drastically affect performance on slower devices if there are a lot of icons displaying at once.
This option handles how the status bar responds to the volume popup. If it does not overlap the status bar, this does not need to be checked. This might not work on some devices.
Shows confusing debug info about window changes.

This keeps the Status service in the foreground and prevents it from being automatically shut down due to conserve memory or battery life. Disabling this setting could improve performance, but it could also cause various stability issues on some devices.
Allows you to backup or restore all the settings in Status as a text file.
Prevents Status from causing a burn-in on some screens by moving the icons around every two seconds.
Status couldn\'t find a color to use for this application, so it\'s reverted to the default color. You can specify a color to use by clicking this notification.
The switch at the top of the screen allows you to enable and disable the customized status bar. Turn it on to try it!
Find the exact setting you want to change by using Status\'s search bar.
The help section is always being updated and contains almost all the issues that have been encountered by other users using this app.
Can\'t get the right color? Try picking the color from an image instead!
Enable or disable an icon by clicking the check box next to its name.
Change the order of the icons by pressing the up and down buttons next to an icon\'s name.
Don\'t want to modify an entire app?
Change individual screens by clicking the \'expand\' button next to the app\'s name.

h - Hours
 HH - Hours (24h)
 kk - Hours (24h)
 mm - Minutes
 a - AM/PM
 Z - Time Zone
 
 dd - Day of Month
 EEE - Day of Week
 MM - Month (numeric)
 MMM - Month
 yyyy - Year
Are you sure you want to reset all the app-specific preferences? This cannot be undone.
Android developer and professional cabbage eater.
Better known as the Oreo lord, this guy can add more butter to buttery interfaces.
The great lord of Material Design, yeah he makes icons and stuff.
A graphic designer, web designer, and the owner of technologx.com.
Created the spanish translations for the app.
Obviously, it would be hard to make over 100 icons used in this app by myself, so (as well as the ones by the people above) the app uses icons from a few different sources.
Accounting for most of the icons in the app, Google Design has a large database of icons to choose from.
Made by many various contributors, this collection of icons contains useful resources unavailable from Google\'s site.

item.p: \nGlide is a fast and efficient open source media management and image loading framework for Android that wraps media decoding, memory and disk caching, and resource pooling into a simple and easy to use interface.
\nSteppers is a view library for Android based on Material Design guidelines.
\nA library designed to make the organized execution of async processes in Android easy.
\nGson is a Java library that can be used to convert Java Objects into their JSON representation.
